Leaves skin soft without drying it out

customer_reviews.title: Black Market Product! Watered down version!
customer_reviews.text: Very fishy! Been ordering this for my grandkids but my daughter in law commented that the last two deliveries the product is a watered down version. Enough said-I am canceling my subscription & hope Amazon will make in inquiry into this product. By the way -my 5 year old grandkids have been using this product since birth.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly from Selma

customer_reviews.title: Viscosity is off , too watery. Mold inside cap assembly!
customer_reviews.text: I keep ordering my favorite Burt’s Bees Baby Wash from Amazon and every time, it is watery. This last batch though, the cap was sticking and it was hard to squeeze out. I just now forced apart the cap and was so grossed out to see green and black mold inside! With an odor! I unfortunately ordered some more yesterday, I will be sending it back when it arrives tomorrow. Amazon packages it great, but the product is flawed, maybe they’re buying it from somewhere bad? I will be going to Target tomorrow and checking the viscosity myself before purchasing. I will not buy this from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: BenNCharlie's mommy

customer_reviews.title: Ordered fragrance-free creamy, got fragranced clear
customer_reviews.text: We've been using the fragrance-free Burt's Bees shampoo for years, and love it. Or, loved it. We ordered this, expecting the item pictured (the creamy, opaque, fragrance-free version). Instead we received the item that was not in the picture, but rather a clear (not creamy), and fragranced (while being falsely labeled fragrance-free) version. Please bring back the Burt's Bees that's actually fragrance-free!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate description and photo
customer_reviews.text: This is not the creamy version but a clear yellow version. It also is NOT a 99.9% natural version. I’ve purchased it from this link a couple months ago and it was the correct one. I’ll be complaining to Amazon about the inaccuracies and returning them.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Not the same product I love
customer_reviews.text: I bought it from the department store and loved it. Got it from Amazon and it's very watery. Hardly any bubbles on the bath and very different. Disappointed I got 3 bottles of it too. Unsubscribing now.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: watered down.  don't bother getting it online
customer_reviews.text: I have brought Burt's bees in the pharmacy many times and love it. But when I bought it here it is watered down. You can tell right away when I tilt the bottle it was like water. Unlike in the pharmacy it had a thicker look. Brought a 4 pack and already down to less that 1/4 left of the last bottle and it only has been 6wks. Love burts bees but don't buy it here.
customer_reviews.author: Mayra Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Beware-Formula Changed
customer_reviews.text: Re-ordered from previously ordered list in my profile. Come to find out they have changed the formula/recipe/ingredients. Previous bottle said 99.9% natural, new pack received, 98.9% natural. Scent and consistency are completely different. New formula is very watery and for being unscented has an unpleasant smell. Will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Not real Burt’s Bees??
customer_reviews.text: Would give 0 stars if I could. Product was clear, watery and smelled funny. The Burt’s Bees Fragrance Free shampoo and wash I’ve used for years is thicker, cloudy and has no real smell. Not sure what this stuff is, but I won’t use it on my child.
customer_reviews.author: redhaired scandinavian

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this baby wash/shampoo. My baby had cradle cap and his pediatrician recommended hea and shoulders. I used it and the cradle cap would go away and then come back after a few days. But, with Burt's Bees, the cradle cap is gone and has not come back. I've been using this for 2.5 months and so far it's the best for babies. I used J&J, Sove, and Aveeno; there is no comparison. It does not lather, but it works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Haddad

customer_reviews.title: Great for Burt's Bees lovers...
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter has slight eczema and we decided to try this product as a friend recommended it and bought it as a gift for the baby shower. After using it I loved the smell it left after she finished her bath. Her hair smelled great till the next day and did not cause any eczema problems. Would definitely recommend to others especially if they like other Burt's bees products!! If you are not a fan of their products then would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L.

customer_reviews.title: Different formula — do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Does not suds like my store bought Burt’s baby shampoo. Viscosity is thinner. Has either been watered down or Burt’s has changed their formula. Either way, will not be purchasing online again. Side note: I have experienced the “watered down” effect with several other merchants and am finding this to be a more diffuse problem. Amazon, are you tracking these complaints?
customer_reviews.author: Anna Seagraves

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids with sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Our kids suffer from eczema and we've tried a bunch of different products, and finally came to the conclusion that Burt's Bee Shampoo and Wash was the one that was the least irritating. We still make sure to moisturize their skin with non-petroleum based skin moisturizer. We use the Original scent - you can our preferred essential oils to make it smell the way you want to.
customer_reviews.author: YokT

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this soap for few years now. But with our recent order, I feel the quality is gone down or I am not sure if something changed with the product. There is not enough lather and I feel it is not cleaning well
customer_reviews.author: Vin

customer_reviews.title: watered down
customer_reviews.text: I remember the same product 8 years ago, it lasted for weeks! This new product is watered down . There is no foam at all. I noticed that I have to buy it frequently, because I use more than usually. My last 4 orders had different consistency than usually.
customer_reviews.author: KateKL

customer_reviews.title: No tears!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product (diluted with water) to wash my eyes every day, in accordance with my opthamologist's instructions. It's quite satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah909

customer_reviews.title: Watered down version!!!! Check all the reviews. Don't Buy here!!
customer_reviews.text: This is horrible! I was gifted a set that was bought in a store and was loved by my baby. The one ordered from Amazon is completely watered down!! It barely lathered, last time I buy this product. Should have looked at the reviews who had similar experiences. Save yourself money.
customer_reviews.author: Luis F

customer_reviews.title: Smells great for baby
customer_reviews.text: We love the smell of this on both of our babies. It smells great for a long time afterwards. It doesn't work very well on adults if you happen to be in the kid's bathroom and use it out of desperation, but it definitely nakes babies smell like yummy little babies.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.andMrs.MorenoTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great for Sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: My baby girl has sensitive skin. We have to use water wipes and sometimes even a damp cloth. We had tons of sample left over from all the baby registries and after a year we finally needed to buy some. She has no issues with tears, or irritation. Couldn’t be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Off Brand Dad

customer_reviews.title: Watery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this originally from Target and fell in love with the scent from the first use!! Once I ran out I decided to get it off Amazon because it was Prime and cheaper. I realize now why it’s cheaper. The product is sooo watery it’s hard to get it to lather unless you use a ton. The only reason I gave a 2nd star is because the scent still smells good despite the watery texture.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Mostly water, Leaves hair greasy.
customer_reviews.text: Be carful when you go to put it in your hand, it's ;ike holding water. Since its mostly water. It leaves a greasy sticky feeling film in your hair, so have a second bottle of another shampoos to wash out the shampoo. I hated it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Gentle, safe, clean ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My FAVORITE baby shampoo. It smells so good, and it’s gentle on my sons’ skin. As an Esthetician, I’m super picky about skincare ingredients. This is one of the only brands I’d trust to use on my kids! I use it myself as body wash, too!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Boarman

customer_reviews.title: Best product for babies & teenagers Skin!

Time to find a replacement. So disappointed.

I solely used this shampoo for about 4 years on my kids but over the years have noticed it get thinner and thinner. It is currently the thickness of water. Would have to turn the bottle over the kids heads just to be sure the shampoo made it there. Disappointed by this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smells so good

customer_reviews.author: CMTM

customer_reviews.text: This shampoo was ordered for our daughter who has very sensitive skin (rubbing her cheek on the carpet will give her a rash). This shampoo works to keep her clean without irritating her skin. It's worth noting that the fragrant version of this product was used previously with no issues; We just wanted to try this one. My only real complaint about the product is the fragrance-free smell. It has a kind-of wheat/oat smell, as can be expected given the ingredients. That being said, while I found it to be somewhat off-putting, my wife said she liked the.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Finnigan

customer_reviews.title: Great product

customer_reviews.title: Fragrance free is only way to go!
customer_reviews.text: We love the fragrance free body wash for our children. It does have a very delicate, natural scent (maybe kind of lemony?) but nothing fake and perfume-like. Our 3-year-old has a lot of hair and is finally outgrowing it (won't lather well enough in his hair). But we still love it for our baby. It is perfectly tear free. We accidentally bought the regular scented kind once (along with the scented lotion). It is awful! The smell is so unbelievably overpowering and not even baby-like. At least the traditional Johnson & Johnson has a sweet smell. Burts Bees went way overboard with their scent!
customer_reviews.author: L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not the same product I like

customer_reviews.author: Carina

customer_reviews.title: Gentle, great smell, and my kids like to use it.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of use with this particular shampoo. My kids have an easier time using this one vs. some of the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Favorite for kids!
customer_reviews.text: We have used many different shampoos and body washes on the kids over the years but none can compare to Burt's Bees!
customer_reviews.author: Jun Cai

customer_reviews.title: Love Burt's bees
customer_reviews.text: I know it says fragrance free but there is a small fragrance, the Burt's bees fragrance. It's slight and not overwhelming at all. We use this for our 2-year-old and will use it for our newborn and I find this product refreshing. The fragrance I smell is light and earthy, unlike Johnson and Johnson baby shampoo/body wash which reminds me of the hospital, has a bit more sterile smell. You don't need to use much to work up a lather so even though the containers are smaller, the product lasts as long because you don't need as much. Over all I'm very happy I switched to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie mom of boys

customer_reviews.title: I love this shampoo/baby wash
customer_reviews.text: I love this shampoo/baby wash. My baby has very sensitive skin. Johnson & Johnson baby wash irritates her skin. Burts Bees is wonderful. She comes out smelling great, her skin does not get irritated, and since it is 99.9% natural, I don't worry as much when she tries to drink her bath water. Some people have complained that it isn't sudsy enough but I lather it in my hand and it seems sudsy enough to meet...although you will not get big bubble bath type bubbles if hats what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Kwase

customer_reviews.title: Wish there was a big pump bottle, but like this a lot
customer_reviews.text: This is our favorite baby shampoo/body wash. I use it for both my 2 year old and 4 year old. Previously I used California Baby, but as the kids got older, I found myself going through it way too fast and it was too expensive. I found Burts Bees, and wish I had used this from the start! Much more cost effective, and smells great. I just wish I could find a big bottle with a pump, I think I waste too much pouring it into a washcloth. I have to use a detangler/conditioner on my daughter's hair after using this, so it doesn't condition well, but I find that to be true of all shampoos.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: NOT what is pictured
customer_reviews.text: The picture and title indicate that this is the creamy shampoo and wash. It is far from that. It is a yellow, watery substance. I have tried to initiate a return and it says that this product is not eligible for a return. I am not happy. Save your money and purchase this product from a credible vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Grantham

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Fragrance Free Option
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this shampoo regularly because it is an excellent option for those who want a fragrance free shampoo.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund Campion

customer_reviews.title: Watery and doesn't create many bubbles.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because all of the reviews I read said this stuff created more bubbles then the actual Burt's bees bubble bath. Which was false. It does work decent for shampoo and body wash, though it is a bit watery. But as far as a "bubble bath" goes, I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not creamy
customer_reviews.text: The photo shows that this is the creamy version of the soap. When I received it it was not. It was the clearish yellow version. I am super disappointed by the false advertising. My children’s skin is very sensitive and the clear yellow soap is too harsh for their skin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the lip balm
customer_reviews.text: I got these after moving from a humid state to a very dry one and was not impressed. I love Burt’s bees lip balm but these hair products just don’t cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Our all time favorite baby shampoo/body wash!
customer_reviews.text: We love this shampoo/body wash! It is natural, smells great and is sensitive to our little one's skin. Not tested on animals is a great plus and just another reason why we chose this brand. On top of that you don't need much and the bottle lasts us for a long time, even with daily baths!
customer_reviews.author: MarionTheWanderingKraut

customer_reviews.title: Watery
customer_reviews.text: Super thin and watery. You need to use a lot, so it doesn’t last long.

customer_reviews.title: Smells wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I love the smell of this baby shampoo! I don't know if it's any more effective at getting a troublesome tot to sleep because of the lavender, but I use it in the hope it does anyway. It doesn't seem to sting my tots eyes either. The price was much better than the stores near me, & my soap arrived really quick! I'll be adding this to my monthly order!
customer_reviews.author: SingleClutchMom

customer_reviews.title: Love this product.
customer_reviews.text: I used so many baby wash and shampoo and I didn’t like any. As soon as I tried this brand I fell in love because it leaves my baby skin very soft, it makes bubbles (many baby wash don’t), and I love the smell (like honey). The consistency is not heavy but not watery, just the perfect combination.
customer_reviews.author: clari

customer_reviews.title: Quality/consistency it not like how it use to be
customer_reviews.text: It feels like the consistency of the wash/shampoo is thinner every time I order it ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Boumy Funes

customer_reviews.title: Gentle for baby
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this wash on my LO since she was an infant. Still use it to this day. Lathers well, smells good and is gentle on the body and face. Even when soap gets in her eyes, she just squeezes them shut but doesn't cry from pain.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Gentle but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice gentle shampoo and wash. It doesn't seem to clean or lather as well as the original Burt's Bees shampoo but generally does the trick unless my toddler is super sticky or sweaty. It's not too great at removing things like zinc based sunscreens but with a little repetition, I am able to remove it. The scent is not a typical baby shampoo scent although it's not unpleasant either. It's more important to me to have a shampoo free of irritating fragrances than for my babies to have that powdery smell.
customer_reviews.author: Janine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Baby (used it from birth until now - 13 months)
customer_reviews.text: This is the only shampoo and body wash I use for my baby who is 13 months old. It is very light and mild, cleans her well, but also rinses off easily without leaving any residue. She hasn't had any reactions to it at all, and she has very sensitive skin. I make her lotion to use following her baths, and her skin is loving the combination of this body wash and her lotion. Also, I love the smell.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best baby wash we have used for our two girls
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best baby wash we have used for our two girls. It is super gentle on all parts of the body. The best part is certainly the smell. It's divine! Babies always smell good anyway (well, until they've spit up all over themselves :) but this makes them smell even snugglier. I love how the faint scent lingers on their skin and hair even after a day or two. Wish it came in big bulk sizes!
customer_reviews.author: J. Armerding

customer_reviews.title: KNOCK OFF - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I love the real Burt’s Bees. This seems to either be a knock off or they changed their formula. It’s watered down and irritates my daughters eyes. I won’t be buying this from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: CMSmith

customer_reviews.title: This has such a nice, light honey scent
customer_reviews.text: This has such a nice, light honey scent. I enjoy using it, and it makes my kids smell nice. The bottle is a nice size and shape to sit next to the tub without falling in all the time. It is normal as far as shampoo goes-- no amazing benefits or drawbacks as far as my hair after I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Bull

customer_reviews.title: Great product!

It has a soft gentle smell, which lingers in my children's hair and I love the scent. It never hurts their eyes and cleans them well too! I will definitely keep buying this product. We have a bottle in each bathroom at all times!
customer_reviews.author: brooke

customer_reviews.title: Reason for bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: I initially wrote a negative review for this product because of the smell. It didn't irritate my daughter's eyes, just smelled weird. I went to Target and compared the smell of the regular Burt's Bees and the fragrance free version and found the fragrance free version smelled off as well. I had always bought the one with fragrance and didn't know there was a difference. So if you never buy the fragrance free version, you may be put off a bit by the smell, but it's still the same product. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Lana R

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Burts Bees standards

It does have a little bit of a fragrance but it doesn't seem to bother my allergies. The only down side to this product is my husband says when he uses it as a body wash it makes him itchy.

customer_reviews.title: They changed the ingredients!
customer_reviews.text: A change in formulation! Check the ingredients! Been using the fragrance free since my son was a newborn ( now 3). Picked it because of its high ratings on EWG skin deep as very low toxicity. When I ordered more I noticed the ingredients were different..... filed a data report on EWG (since they didn't have the updated ingredients on their site) and it scored a 2 which used to be a 1. So burts bees has changed it to be slightly more toxic than it was before. A score of 2 is considered "fair" by EWG so it is not terrible but it says something about the company.
